alert.note: Alert for Orange; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 11 at 3:25AM EST until March 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, mainly Saturday afternoon and night. * WHERE...Orange and Windsor Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 1 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy wet snow is expected throughout the Connecticut River Valley Saturday morning but will begin to transition to a drier snow Saturday afternoon and evening. Wet snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches will be possible in the Connecticut River Valley. Elsewhere, 6 to 10 inches of snow is expected with a period of heavy snow early Saturday afternoon. Gusty winds will develop Saturday afternoon and continue until Sunday morning. This could lead to areas of blowing snow outside of the Connecticut River Valley and create very low visibility on area roadways.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.
